page.title: 02EVENTS -MAY DAY -WORTHEN
page.content: MONDAY 6TH MAY 1985 The first Monday in May is a Public Holiday and the Scouts,Cubs,and Beavers (boys 7-15) held a May Fair on the Village Field. There was a {Fancy {Dress }competition and various activities; mini motor bikes,pony rides,video car-drive, coconut shy, Aunt Sally, treasure island, bottle stall, and air-rifle shooting. At the end of the afternoon{a crazy football {match}was held -the ladies dressed up as men, the men as women. After a lot of cheating the ladies won. Finally there were running races for the children.Refreshments could be bought: chips,jacket potatoes,tea,coffee,and squash. This is becoming an annual event to raise money for the boys'activit- ies. The girls go to Brownies in Minsterley.
